subject: Re: Help on testing EJBs
msgSnippet: Sorry but I left out a line of code when i posted the orig message. The corrected code is below Context initial = new InitialContext(); Thanks for the help
messageBody:
Sorry but I left out a line of code when i posted the orig message.
The corrected code is below
"Context initial = new InitialContext();"

Thanks for the help
Luis

> -------BEGIN CODE-----------
>
> package com.reta.af.viewfinder.test;
>
> import junit.framework.*;
> import com.reta.af.eventhandler.*;
> import com.reta.af.viewfinder.*;
> import com.reta.af.common.viewfinder.*;
>
> import javax.naming.Context;
> import javax.naming.InitialContext;
> import javax.rmi.PortableRemoteObject;
>
> public class ViewFinderTest extends TestCase
> {
> protected ViewFinderRemote vfr;
>
> public ViewFinderTest(String name)
> {
> super(name);
> }
>
> public static void main (String[] args)
> {
> junit.textui.TestRunner.run (suite());
> }
>
> protected void setUp() throws Exception
> {
> try
> {
Context initial = new InitialContext(p);
> Object objref = initial.lookup("ViewFinder");
> ViewFinderHome home = (ViewFinderHome)
> PortableRemoteObject.narrow(objref, ViewFinderHome.class);
> this.vfr = home.create();
> }
> catch (Exception ex2 )
> {
> System.out.println(ex2.getMessage());
> }
>
> }
>
>
> public static Test suite()
> {
> return new TestSuite(ViewFinderTest.class);
> }
>
> public void testGetView() throws Exception
> {
>
> try
> {
>
> //Set the test attributes
> ViewFinder viewFinderObj = new ViewFinder();
> viewFinderObj.setTaskname("com.reta.pmwb.start.TLogin");
> viewFinderObj.setAudience(new Integer(1));
> viewFinderObj.setChannel("H");
>
> //Instantiate Return Value
> View retView = new View();
>
> //Instantiate Expected Value and Set Attributes
> View expView = new View();
> expView.setUrl("/loginSuccess.jsp");
> expView.setStylesheet("style.css");
>
> try
> {
> retView = this.vfr.getView(viewFinderObj);
> }
>
> catch (java.rmi.RemoteException x)
> {
> // do something here
> }
>
> //Compare expected and return values
> //** good code: assertEquals(expView, retView);
> fail("This is a manual fail");
>
> }
>
> catch (Exception ex)
> {
> }
>
> }
>
> }
